page.title: 05HOUSING NEAR ST.AGNES
page.content: MOST PLACES HAVE MAINS ELECTRICITY BUT HAVE ONLY BEEN ON MAINS FOR THE LAST 30 YEARS. THERE ARE ONE OR TWO ISOLATED COTTAGES THAT STILL HAVE NO ELECTRICITY AND HEAT THE HOUSES BY OPEN FIRES,COOK BY A RAYBURN AND USE OIL LAMPS. EVERY ONE NOW HAS RUNNING WATER BUT A FEW STILL HAVE WELLS THAT ARE IN USE.VERY FEW HOUSES IN THE AREA HAVE MAINS DRAINAGE AND THERE IS NO MAINS GAS.APART FROM A FEW HAMLETS AND SMALL VILLAGES THE AREA IS RURAL AND THE HOUSES ARE SCATTERED.MANY OF THE COTTAGES ARE WELL OVER A HUNDRED YEARS OLD.
